definition: to correct/to rectify/to redress/strong/brave/to pretend/to feign/affectation
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: It is proved that to over-correct is another fault.
sentences.chinese: 矯枉過正不過是在錯誤的基礎上又犯了另一個錯誤。

sentences.english: The complicacy of elements and driving mechanism are the main cause of hypercorrection.
sentences.chinese: 矯枉過正的深層原因是要素和驅動機制的複雜性。

sentences.english: It is caught in oscillations of overcompensation.
sentences.chinese: 受矯枉過正的影響，機身陷入俯仰震盪。

sentences.english: Yet it is also essential that nations resist the temptation to overcorrect by imposing regulations that would stifle innovation and choke off growth.
sentences.chinese: 國家也要避免矯枉過正而導致限制創新和中斷增長。

sentences.english: BrainTrust Query: Can Task Management Go Too Far?
sentences.chinese: 任務管理是否會矯枉過正？

sentences.english: There is a danger of moving too quickly, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，矯枉過正的問題還是存在的。

sentences.english: Don't make excuses, beat yourself up, or overcompensate for your error.
sentences.chinese: 不要找藉口，被自己打敗或矯枉過正。

definition: to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
